issue.title: Integrate Falcon from PQClean
issue.body: This PR adds all Falcon signature schemes from PQClean.

issue.title: Link error for MacOS 10.14.5
issue.body:
While attempting to build the code:
 autoreconf -i
 ./configure
 make clean
 make -j

During make-j 

.....
libtool: link: gcc -dynamiclib -Wl,-undefined -Wl,dynamic_lookup -o .libs/liboqs.0.dylib   -Wl,-force_load,src/common/.libs/libcommon.a -Wl,-force_load,src/crypto/aes/.libs/libaes.a -Wl,-force_load,src/crypto/sha2/.libs/libsha2.a -Wl,-force_load,src/crypto/sha3/.libs/libsha3.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/.libs/libkem.a -Wl,-force_load,src/sig/.libs/libsig.a -Wl,-force_load,src/sig/picnic/.libs/libpicnic_i.a -Wl,-force_load,src/sig/qtesla/.libs/libqtesla.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/bike/.libs/libkembike.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/kyber/.libs/libkemkyber.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/newhope/.libs/libkemnewhope.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/ntru/.libs/libkemntru.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/saber/.libs/libkemsaber.a -Wl,-force_load,src/sig/dilithium/.libs/libsigdilithium.a -Wl,-force_load,src/sig/mqdss/.libs/libsigmqdss.a -Wl,-force_load,src/sig/sphincs/.libs/libsigsphincs.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/frodokem/.libs/libkemfrodokem.a -Wl,-force_load,src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a  -L/usr/local/opt/opencv@2/lib -L/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/lib -lcrypto  -g -O3 -g -O2 -mmmx -mpopcnt -msse -msse2 -msse3 -msse4.1 -msse4.2 -mavx -mavx2 -mfma -mbmi -maes   -install_name  /usr/local/lib/liboqs.0.dylib -compatibility_version 1 -current_version 1.0 -Wl,-single_module
ld: illegal text reloc in 'oqs_sig_qteslapi_poly_ntt_asm' to 'oqs_sig_qteslapi_PARAM_QINVx4' for architecture x86_64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make[2]: *** [liboqs.la] Error 1
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make: *** [all] Error 2

issue.title: Disabled qtesla avx2 optimizations on darwin
issue.body:
qtesla's avx2 assembly only targets linux, so this PR disables the optimization on darwin.

Addresses issue #571.

comment.body: Fixes the build error on my Mac.

issue.title: Disabled qtesla avx2 optimizations on darwin
issue.body:
qtesla's avx2 assembly only targets linux, so this PR disables the optimization on darwin.

Addresses issue #571.

comment.body: The lack of build errors means it's probably fine, but in the long run I am concerned about how a line of code like [this](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/master/tests/test_kat.py#L31) would square with the selective-platform disables.

issue.title: KEMS can now be built using CMake.
issue.body:
This PR should have the basic framework with which the KEMS will be built using CMake. Once all the concerns over this are resolved, what is left is to:

1) Fix SIKE warnings.
2) Add templating code, feature (SSE, AVX) detection functionality, and ARM/Android cross-compilation ability.
3) Did I miss anything?

I've also left the existing build system intact to keep the diff clean and to make rebasing with master easier.

To build on UNIX-y systems: `mkdir build && cd build && cmake .. && make`
To build on Windows: `mkdir build && cd build && cmake -G "NMake Makefiles" .. && nmake"` in the VS Developer console. Alternatively, just running `cmake ..` will generate build files for Visual Studio.

Signature support will come after all this.

comment.body: @vsoftco could you take a look at [config/cpu-extensions.cmake](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/9a572908df35ebceaa031b7d94ba173e7fb54cf6/config/cpu-extensions.cmake) and tell me if there's a better way of doing this?

qtesla's avx2 assembly only targets linux, so this PR disables the optimization on darwin.

comment.body: Right @xvzcf, this could be problematic; that whole script is a bit hacky and would need improvement. @dstebila, does your machine support avx2 and aes cpu instructions, and if so, does `make test` works too?

qtesla's avx2 assembly only targets linux, so this PR disables the optimization on darwin.

comment.body:
Here's the contents of my `oqsconfig.h` which shows which flags are supported. 

In `make test`, `tests/test_cmdline.py::test_sig[qTesla-p-I]` and `tests/test_cmdline.py::test_sig[qTesla-p-III]` pass, but `tests/test_kat.py::test_sig[qTesla-p-I]` and `tests/test_kat.py::test_sig[qTesla-p-III]` fail.

```c
#define OQS_COMPILE_BUILD_TARGET "x86_64-apple-darwin19.2.0"
#define OQS_COMPILE_CFLAGS "-g -O2  -mmmx -mpopcnt -msse -msse2 -msse3 -msse4.1 -msse4.2 -mavx -mavx2 -mfma -mbmi -maes -I/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/include  -std=gnu11 -Wall -Wextra -Werror  -Wimplicit -Wunused -Wcomment -Wchar-subscripts -Wuninitialized -Wstrict-prototypes -Wshadow -Wformat-security -Wwrite-strings  -Wno-missing-braces -Wno-missing-field-initializers -g  -fPIC  -fvisibility=hidden  -I/Users/dstebila/Desktop/OQS/cp-liboqs/include -I.  -I/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/include  -O3  -fomit-frame-pointer  -DCONSTANT_TIME "
#define OQS_COMPILE_LDFLAGS " -L/usr/local/opt/openssl@1.1/lib"
#define OQS_ENABLE_KEM_bike1_l1_cpa 1
```

comment.body: Ok, thanks @dstebila. @xvzcf, I think we've established that the travis mac machines are old, and probably don't support the optimized flag, so that would not have tripped the kat selection test. I'll update the script as you pointed out.
